newsitem.title: USA: U.S. corp debt issuers get set to unload supply.
newsitem.headline: U.S. corp debt issuers get set to unload supply.

text.p: An increasing number of corporate debt issuers are getting set to unload a boatload of supply on the primary market as the calendar year ticks away, dealers said.
"The tone in the market is better today," said one syndicate source. "This will prompt issuers to come out of the woodwork now and get their financing done before year-end."
Leading the pack is Crown Cork & Seal Co's $1.2 billion multi-tranche debt offering expected to price on Thursday via lead manager Salomon Brothers.
The deal is expected to consist of the following tranches, dealers said.
-$300 million in 30-year bonds with price talk seen in the 85 basis points over Treasuries area.
-$150 million in 100-year bonds with price talk seen in the 95 basis points over Treasuries area.
Crown Cork & Seal (UK unit):
-$200 million in seven-year Yankee debt, price talk is seen at 60 basis points and $300 million in 10-year debt with price talk seen at 67 to 70 basis points over Treasuries
Crown Cork & Seal (France unit):
-$200 million in seven-year Yankee debt with price talk in the 60 basis points area.

MidAmerican Energy is also getting set to issue $100 million in A3/A rated senior unsecured five-year notes via PaineWebber, sources said. Price talk on the issue is in the 41 to 43 basis points arena.
Rite Aid Corp, American Re Insurance and Israel Electric are on the menu for next week's investment grade offerings, dealers said.
Meanwhile, issuers are getting set to unleash a bulk of new high-yield supply as investors stand ready to scoop it up, dealers added.
Among the upcoming high-yield debt offerings are:
AK Steel Corp's $550 million in 10-year 144A notes via CS First Boston.
AES China Generating's $180 million 10-year debt offering via lead underwriter Morgan Stanley. Price talk on the issue is seen in the 400 basis points area, sources said.
Also, Jacor Communications' $125 million in 10-year senior subordinated notes via Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette. Price talk on the issue is 9.625 to 9.875 percent, sources said.
Phonetel Technologies' $110 million in 10-year senior notes via JP Morgan Securities has price talk in area of 11.75 to 12.0 percent.
Delta Beverage Group is also expected to issue $120 million in seven-year 144A notes via NationsBanc. Price talk is seen between 9.625 and 9.875 percent.
Katz Media Corp is expected to set $100 million in 10-year 144A notes via Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette Securities.
Safelite Glass Corp is also expected to tap the market with $100 million in 10-year 144A senior subordinated notes via Chase Securities.
In the government market, the 30-year U.S. Treasury bond is up 20/32 at 98-30/32 to yield 6.58 percent.
--Nancy Leinfuss, 212-859-1675
